    • Method Detail

      • createDocumentStepCameraOverlay

        @NonNull
protected android.view.View createDocumentStepCameraOverlay()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Creates and returns camera overlay view for the document verification step. This is appropriate place where references to all camera overlay subviews, that must be available later, should be obtained.
        Specified by:
        createDocumentStepCameraOverlay in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Returns:
        created camera overlay view.

      • onStartDocumentFirstSide

        protected void onStartDocumentFirstSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan first side and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Specified by:
        onStartDocumentFirstSide in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onStartDocumentSecondSide

        protected void onStartDocumentSecondSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan second side (only if second side exists) and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Specified by:
        onStartDocumentSecondSide in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onGlare

        public void onGlare(boolean glareDetected)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback that is called during recognition process when/if the glare is detected on the scanned document. This is appropriate place to perform UI updates and inform user that glare is detected (or that glare is not present any more).
        Specified by:
        onGlare in interface GlareCallback
        Specified by:
        onGlare in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        glareDetected - whether glare is detected or not.

      • createAdditionalStepConfiguration

        @Nullable
protected AdditionalStepConfiguration createAdditionalStepConfiguration()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Creates configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step.
        Specified by:
        createAdditionalStepConfiguration in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Returns:
        configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step, or null if the additional verification step is not needed. In that case additional step will not be performed.

      • pauseScanning

        public void pauseScanning()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        If the RecognizerRunnerView has been created, pauses the scanning loop by calling RecognizerRunnerView.pauseScanning(). But keeps camera active. If the RecognizerRunnerView has not been created yet, does nothing. You can resume scanning by calling BaseVerificationOverlayController.resumeScanning().
        Overrides:
        pauseScanning in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        See Also:
        RecognizerRunnerView.pauseScanning()

      • resumeScanning

        public void resumeScanning()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        If the RecognizerRunnerView has been created, resumes the scanning loop (that has been paused) by calling RecognizerRunnerView.resumeScanning(boolean) }. If the RecognizerRunnerView has not been created yet, does nothing.
        Overrides:
        resumeScanning in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        See Also:
        RecognizerRunnerView.resumeScanning(boolean)
